content.raw:
I made a couple of suggestions on the `RandomVelocityPlugin` branch in the OSRF repo. [Here](https://bitbucket.org/meha27/gazebo_tutorials/branches/compare/osrf/gazebo_tutorials:RandomVelocityPlugin%0Dmeha27/gazebo_tutorials:RandomVelocityPlugin#diff)'s the diff. I recommend the side-by-side diff view. The diff is big but mostly it was about making the lines around 80 chars, so it is easier to see diffs in the future. I also highlighted some variables with \`\`, fixed indentation and some links. Feel free to merge the changes which you agree with.

There are many links which still need to be double checked, especially the ones for the API. There was a link for `ElementPtr` for example referencing an old version of Gazebo when SDF was still part of it. We should make sure all links refer to the gazebo6 API.

Besides these details, I think it's a great tutorial. The detailed explanation of Gazebo's inner workings and all the references to the API are great for people learning about Gazebo for the first time!
content.html:
I made a couple of suggestions on the RandomVelocityPlugin branch in the OSRF repo. Here's the diff. I recommend the side-by-side diff view. The diff is big but mostly it was about making the lines around 80 chars, so it is easier to see diffs in the future. I also highlighted some variables with ``, fixed indentation and some links. Feel free to merge the changes which you agree with.

There are many links which still need to be double checked, especially the ones for the API. There was a link for ElementPtr for example referencing an old version of Gazebo when SDF was still part of it. We should make sure all links refer to the gazebo6 API.

Besides these details, I think it's a great tutorial. The detailed explanation of Gazebo's inner workings and all the references to the API are great for people learning about Gazebo for the first time!

content.raw:
So I just found out it is possible to preview tutorials directly from forks! This is the link for this one:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=plugins_random_velocity&branch=RandomVelocityPlugin&repo=https://bitbucket.org/meha27/gazebo_tutorials

So @meha27 , whatever changes you make on your fork will immediately reflect on that link ;)
content.html:
So I just found out it is possible to preview tutorials directly from forks! This is the link for this one:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=plugins_random_velocity&branch=RandomVelocityPlugin&repo=https://bitbucket.org/meha27/gazebo_tutorials

So @meha27 , whatever changes you make on your fork will immediately reflect on that link ;)

content.raw:
If relative velocity of A and B is set as constant and and on A the plugin is acted upon, then how B would react to it, i.e. how B's velocity would change now,
so as to maintain the constraint of relative velocity being some constant.
I am changing to be more explicit.
content.html: If relative velocity of A and B is set as constant and and on A the plugin is acted upon, then how B would react to it, i.e. how B's velocity would change now, so as to maintain the constraint of relative velocity being some constant. I am changing to be more explicit.
